com.percussion.webservices.system
Interface IPSSystemWs

public interface IPSSystemWs

This interface defines all system related webservices.

The relationship methods in this interface are made public for advanced uses only (and the relationships should be used read-only, the saveRelationships(List) method must be used w/ special care.) Generally, there are specific methods for each relationship type that should be used for creating/editing each type of relationship that can be found in the IPSContentWs interface.

If the implementer has created a new relationship type that has properties beyond those supported by the standard interfaces, then these methods may prove useful.

The following table shows the preferred create methods for each type of relationship:

Relationship categoryMethod
Active Assembly IPSContentWs.addContentRelations( IPSGuid, List, String, String, int)
New Copy IPSContentWs.newCopies( List, List, String, boolean)
Promotable Version IPSContentWs.newPromotableVersions( List, List, String, boolean)
Translation IPSContentWs.newTranslations( List, List, String, boolean)

Method Detail

switchCommunity

void switchCommunity(String name)
                     throws PSUserNotMemberOfCommunityException
Switch the user to a new community. The user can only switch to communities to which he belongs. Use the list returned with the login response.

Parameters:
name - the community name to which the user will be switched, not null or empty. Must be the an existing community.
Throws:
PSUserNotMemberOfCommunityException - If the user does not belong to the specified community.

switchLocale

void switchLocale(String code)
                  throws PSInvalidLocaleException
Switch to the specified locale. The user can only switch to installed and enabled locales. Use the list received with the login response.

Parameters:
code - the code of the locale to which the user wants to switch, e.g. en-us, not null or empty, must be an installed and enabled locale.
Throws:
PSInvalidLocaleException - If the specified locale does not exist or is inactive.

createRelationship

PSRelationship createRelationship(String name,
                                  IPSGuid ownerId,
                                  IPSGuid depenentId)
                                  throws PSErrorException
Creates a new relationship for the specified parameters. The created relationship is persisted to the repository. This method should not generally be used by implementers unless they have defined custom relationship types that have properties not supported by the standard creation methods. See the class description for the proper way to create relationships.

Parameters:
name - the name or the relationship type definition to create, not null or empty, must be an existing relationship type.
ownerId - the id of the relationship owner, not null, must be an id to an existing object. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager. If the relationship type uses owner revision, then the revision of this id must be either -1 or the head revision (which is edit revision if the item is checked out or current revision if the item is not checked out).
depenentId - the id of the relationship dependent, not null, must be the id to an existing object. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager. If the relationship type uses dependent revision, then the revision of this id must be either -1 or the head revision (which is edit revision if the item is checked out or current revision if the item is not checked out).
Returns:
a new relationship between the specified onwer and dependent of the requested type, never null. All relationship properties are initialized with the defaults as specified in the relationship type definition. The owner revision will be the head (edit or current) revision of the owner item if the relationship type uses the owner revision. The dependent revision will be the head (edit or current) revision of the dependent item if the relationship type uses the dependent revision.
Throws:
PSErrorException - if any error occurs.

loadRelationships

List<PSRelationship> loadRelationships(PSRelationshipFilter filter)
                                       throws PSErrorException
Load all relationships for the specified relationship filter. Note that a system may have thousands of relationships defined and the perfomance may be poor if the supplied filter is too general.

In general, this method should not be used for relationships whose category is ActiveAssembly because there are rules associated with that relationship type that are not enforced by this API. Instead, the loadContentRelations method should be used.

Parameters:
filter - defines the parameters by which to filter the returned relationships, may be null. If not supplied or no filter parameters are specified, all relationships will be returned.
Returns:
a list with all loaded relationships ordered by id, never null, may be empty.
Throws:
PSErrorException - if failed to load the relationships.

saveRelationships

void saveRelationships(List<PSRelationship> relationships)
                       throws PSErrorsException
Saves the supplied relationships to the repository.

This method should never be used for relationships whose category is ActiveAssembly because there are rules associated with that relationship type that are not enforced by this API. Instead, the saveContentRelations method should be used.

Parameters:
relationships - a list with all relationships to be saved to the repository, not null or empty.
Throws:
PSErrorsException - if failed to save specified relationships.

deleteRelationships

void deleteRelationships(List<IPSGuid> ids)
                         throws PSErrorsException,
                                PSErrorException
Deletes all relationships specified through the supplied ids. Deletes cannot be reverted. Implementers should not use this method.

For ActiveAssembly relationships, use the deleteContentRelations. For all other types of relationships, they will be deleted when the owner or dependent is deleted.

Parameters:
ids - a list with all relationship ids to be deleted, not null or empty. We ignore cases where a relationship of a supplied id does not exist.
Throws:
PSErrorsException - if failed to remove any specified relationships.
PSErrorException - if any error occurs.

findDependents

List<IPSGuid> findDependents(IPSGuid contentId,
                             PSRelationshipFilter filter)
                             throws PSErrorException
Find all relationship dependents for the specified owner and filter.

Parameters:
contentId - the owner id for which to find the dependents, not null. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager, and must be the id of a valid object.
filter - defines the parameters by which to filter the returned children, may be null. If not supplied or no filter parameters are specified, all children will be returned. Note, the owner of the filter will be ignored if specified.
Returns:
a list of object ids for all children found for the specified object and filter parameters, never null, may be empty.
Throws:
PSErrorException - if any error occurs.

findOwners

List<IPSGuid> findOwners(IPSGuid contentId,
                         PSRelationshipFilter filter)
                         throws PSErrorException
Find all relationship owners for the specified dependent and filter.

Parameters:
contentId - the dependent id for which to find the owners, not null. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager, and must be the id of a valid object.
filter - defines the parameters by which to filter the returned parents, may be null. If not supplied or no filter parameters are specified, all parents will be returned. Note, the dependents of the filter will be ignored if specified.
Returns:
a list of object ids for all parents found for the specified object and filter, never null, may be empty.
Throws:
PSErrorException - if any error occurs.

loadRelationshipTypes

List<PSRelationshipConfig> loadRelationshipTypes(String name,
                                                 String category)
                                                 throws PSErrorException
Loads all relationship types for the supplied parameters in read-only mode.

Parameters:
name - the relationship type name to load, may be null or empty, asterisk wildcards are accepted. If not supplied or empty, all relationship types will be loaded.
category - the relationship category for which to load the configurations, may be null but not empty. Must be an existing category. All relationship configurations will be loaded if not supplied.
Returns:
a list with all loaded relationship configurations in read-only mode, never null, may be empty, alpha ordered by name.
Throws:
PSErrorException - if an error occurs while loading the relationship types.

loadAuditTrails

Map<IPSGuid,List<com.percussion.services.system.data.PSContentStatusHistory>> loadAuditTrails(List<IPSGuid> ids)
                                                                                              throws PSErrorException
Loads the workflow audit trails for each supplied item.

Parameters:
ids - a list of item ids for which to get the audit trails, not null or empty. It is an error if no item exists for any of the supplied ids. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager and the revision of the id is ignored.
Returns:
a list of audit trails, grouped by the specified item id.
Throws:
PSErrorException - if any item does not exist.

transitionItems

@Deprecated
List<String> transitionItems(List<IPSGuid> ids,
                                        String transition,
                                        String user)
                             throws PSErrorsException,
                                    PSErrorException
Deprecated. Use transitionItems(List, String)

Throws:
PSErrorsException
PSErrorException

transitionItems

List<String> transitionItems(List<IPSGuid> ids,
                             String transition)
                             throws PSErrorsException,
                                    PSErrorException
Transition all items identified through the supplied item ids and transition name.

Parameters:
ids - a list of ids for all items to be trasitioned, not null or empty. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager. It is an error if no item exists for any of the supplied ids. All items must be in checked in mode or they must be checked out by the requested user. The revision of an id (in the specified ids) may be -1; otherwise it must be the current revision of the item.
transition - the name or the transition to use for each item, not null or empty. It is an error if no transition exists for any of the specified items current state or if the supplied transition does not exist.
Returns:
a list of state names to which the requested items were transitioned to in the same order as requested, never null or empty.
Throws:
PSErrorsException - if failed to transition a specified item.
PSErrorException - if any other error occurs.

transitionItems

@Deprecated
List<String> transitionItems(List<IPSGuid> ids,
                                        String transition,
                                        String comment,
                                        List<String> adhocUsers,
                                        String user)
                             throws PSErrorsException,
                                    PSErrorException
Deprecated. Use transitionItems(List, String, String, List)

Throws:
PSErrorsException
PSErrorException

transitionItems

List<String> transitionItems(List<IPSGuid> ids,
                             String transition,
                             String comment,
                             List<String> adhocUsers)
                             throws PSErrorsException,
                                    PSErrorException
Transition all items identified through the supplied item ids and transition name.

Parameters:
ids - a list of ids for all items to be trasitioned, not null or empty. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager. It is an error if no item exists for any of the supplied ids. All items must be in checked in mode or they must be checked out by the requested user. The revision of an id (in the specified ids) may be -1; otherwise it must be the current revision of the item.
transition - the name or the transition to use for each item, not null or empty. It is an error if no transition exists for any of the specified items current state or if the supplied transition does not exist.
comment - the comment for this transition. It may be null or empty.
adhocUsers - a list of add hoc users for this transition. It may be null or empty.
Returns:
a list of state names to which the requested items were transitioned to in the same order as requested, never null or empty.
Throws:
PSErrorsException - if failed to transition a specified item.
PSErrorException - if any other error occurs.

loadWorkflows

List<PSWorkflow> loadWorkflows(String name)
Loads all workflows for the supplied name in read-only mode.

Parameters:
name - the name or the workflow to load, may be null or empty, asterisk wildcards are accepted. All workflows will be loaded if null or empty.
Returns:
a list with all loaded workflows in read-only mode, never null, may be empty, alpha ordered by name.

getAllowedTransitions

Map<String,String> getAllowedTransitions(List<IPSGuid> ids)
Get the list of allowed transition names for the current user and supplied item ids.

Parameters:
ids - The list of ids, may not be null. This must be a content guid obtained from one of the IPS*Ws interfaces or from the IPSGuidManager.
Returns:
A map of allowed transition names, never null, might be empty. Key is the transition name, value is the label. If multiple ids are supplied, then the intersection of each of their allowed transitions is returned.
